'''Sadoc Brandybuck''' was a Hobbit of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Sadoc was the son of [[Gormadoc Brandybuck]] and [[Malva Headstrong]]. He was born in {{SR|1179}}, the middle child, between his brothers [[Madoc Brandybuck|Madoc]] and [[Marroc Brandybuck|Marroc]]. He has three children, of which the daughter, [[Salvia Brandybuck|Salvia]], was born in {{SR|1226}}.<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymolgy==
The meaning of the name ''Sadoc'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

A Cornish knight named ''Sadoc'' who becomes a Knight of the Round Table and a knight of Orkney named ''Sadoc'' appear in Malory's ''Le Morte Darthur''. There also exists the [[Welsh]] name ''Cadoc'' that is derived from ''cad'' ("battle").<ref name="Allan">{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 204</ref>

==Inspiration==
Two knights called ''Sadoc'' play a role in Malory's ''Le Morte Darthur'': a ''Sadoc'' who is a Cornish knight who is friendly to Sir Tristram and a ''Sadoc'' who is a knight of Orkney.<ref name="Allan"/> ''Cadoc'' is also the name of a Welsh [[Wikipedia:Cadoc|saint]].
